questions.question: You have implemented a workflow for a document from a template, and have outlined the steps taken to create the workflow. Which order of steps is correct?
questions.explanation:
```markdown
1. Select the document in SharePoint.
2. From the ribbon, click Automate > Power Automate > Create a flow.
3. Select the template to use for the workflow.
4. Confirm the flow and any accounts to be used.
5. Configure any specific fields for the workflow.
```
```markdown
1. From the ribbon, click Automate > Power Automate > Create a flow.
2. Select the document in SharePoint.
3. Select the template to use for the workflow.
4. Confirm the flow and any accounts to be used.
5. Configure any specific fields for the workflow.
```
```markdown
1. Select the document in SharePoint.
2. From the ribbon, click Automate > Power Automate > Create a flow.
3. Configure any specific fields for the workflow.
4. Select the template to use for the workflow.
5. Confirm the flow and any accounts to be used.
```
```markdown
1. Select the document in SharePoint.
2. Confirm the flow and any accounts to be used.
3. From the ribbon, click Automate > Power Automate > Create a flow.
4. Select the template to use for the workflow.
5. Configure any specific fields for the workflow.
```

In the list's advanced settings, under Create and edit access, select Create items that were created by the user.

How do you find site usage statistics in SharePoint Online?
questions.answer: On the site home page, click the gear (Settings) icon and go to Site information. Select View all site settings, and then in the Site Administration section, select Site usage statistics.
correctAnswer: On the site home page, click the gear (Settings) icon and go to Site information. Select View all site settings, and then in the Site Administration section, select Site usage statistics.
options: On the site home page, click the gear (Settings) icon and go to Site information. Select View all site settings, and then in the Site Administration section, select Site usage statistics.
On the Site contents page, click Site usage.

In the SharePoint Admin Center, select the SharePoint File Activity report.

questions.question: An organization has deployed a SharePoint parent site that includes a four-level hierarchy of subsites. You want to add another subsite to this hierarchy. What is the hard limit on a subsite hierarchy?
questions.answer: There is a limit of up to five sites (one parent, four subsites) in a single hierarchy.
correctAnswer: There is a limit of up to five sites (one parent, four subsites) in a single hierarchy.
options: There is a limit of up to ten subsites in a single hierarchy.
There is a limit of up to five sites (one parent, four subsites) in a single hierarchy.
There is no hierarchy limit for subsites.
There is a limit of up to five subsites in a single hierarchy.
